intro: Weinmannia lucida, commonly known as the silverleaf weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its distinctive silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, forming dense, spherical inflorescences. Weinmannia lucida is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
